solution_line_template: At the first pick-up point, the number of people who entered the bus was {fraction_entered} of its carrying capacity, a total of {fraction_entered}*{carrying_capacity} = <<{fraction_entered}*{carrying_capacity}={people_entered_first_pickup}>>{people_entered_first_pickup}

The available seats in the bus after the first pick up point is {carrying_capacity}-{people_entered_first_pickup} = <<{carrying_capacity}-{people_entered_first_pickup}={available_seats}>>{available_seats}

If there were {people_at_second_pickup} people in the second pick-up station, and only {available_seats} sits were available, the number of people who did not take the bus because it was full is {people_at_second_pickup}-{available_seats}=<<{people_at_second_pickup}-{available_seats}={people_could_not_take_bus}>>{people_could_not_take_bus}
